vocalization definition: to give voice to.
A sound change whereby a consonant becomes a vowel, particularly common with
Vocal music - Vocal music is a genre of music performed by one or more singers, with or without instrumental accompaniment, in which singing provides the main focus of the piece.
L-vocalization - In linguistics, l-vocalization is a process by which an sound is replaced by a vowel or semivowel sound.
